info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:14PM MDT until July 28 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SPRING BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN COSTILLA AND WEST CENTRAL HUERFANO COUNTIES... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have exited northeast portions of the Spring Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is expected to continue until the water has a chance to recede. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar could result in debris flow moving through the North and South Abeyta Creek and Yellowstone Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Spring Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Spring Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, and La Veta Pass. This includes the following high risk locations... South Abeyta Creek near County Road 443, and South Abeyta Creek near County Road 442. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Spring Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
